original: WHEREAS  IMPCO is engaged in the business of development, manufacture and sale of alternate fuel management systems and components for operating motor vehicles, forklifts, industrial engines and other engines of various horsepower; and WHEREAS  MIL is engaged in the manufacturing and sale of auto electrical parts such as switches, lamps and horns; and WHEREAS  IMPCO and MIL/MINDA have entered into a joint venture to promote a company under the name of MINDA IMPCO LIMITED for manufacturing and selling alternate fuel management systems and components, including but not limited to CNG, LPG and Propane Kits for operating motor vehicles, forklifts, industrial engines and other engines of various horsepower in India ; and WHEREAS,  MIL represents that it has the technical, marketing skills and financial wherewithal to install, sell and service the alternate fuel systems and components manufactured by MINDA IMPCO Limited and enjoys a respected business relationship with cognizant governmental and industrial authorities, all of which may be advantageously employed in the safe and professional marketing of MINDA IMPCO Limited products, as specified above, in India with the approval of and in compliance with such governmental authorities; and WHEREAS  the Parties hereto have agreed, subject to obtaining all necessary approvals, permissions, consents, validations, confirmations, licenses and any other authorizations required to incorporate a company in India ( “the Joint Venture Company”  or the “JVC”) with the main object of  inter alia  marketing and selling of alternate fuel management systems, including but not limited to CNG, LPG and Propane Kits and its components for automobiles and other associated and incidental services to customers; and WHEREAS  IMPCO will contribute to the JVC in cash and the JVC will issue equity shares to IMPCO; and WHEREAS  MIL/MINDA will contribute to the JVC in cash and subject to IMPCO’s consent in kind and the JVC will issue equity shares to MIL/MINDA; and WHEREAS  the Parties hereto are ready, willing and able to assist each other and cooperate in the manner set out hereinafter, to ensure the establishment and success of the JVC. The Parties shall cooperate with each other in the highest degree in the performance of all such acts and the passing of all resolutions as are required for the purpose of achieving the terms, purposes and intent of this Agreement and the Parties shall in particular exercise their respective voting and other rights and power of control over the JVC so as to give effect to the rights conferred upon the respective Parties by the terms of this Agreement.
ollama_generated:
WHEREAS IMPCO specializes in the field of developing, manufacturing, and marketing alternate fuel management systems and components for vehicles, forklifts, industrial engines, and various engines of different horsepower; and WHEREAS MIL excels in the production and distribution of auto electrical parts such as switches, lamps, and horns; and WHEREAS IMPCO and MIL/MINDA have formed a business alliance under the name MINDA IMPCO LIMITED for the purpose of manufacturing and selling alternate fuel management systems and components, including but not limited to CNG, LPG, and Propane Kits, in India. Furthermore, MIL claims to possess the technical expertise, marketing skills, and financial resources necessary to install, market, sell, and service these alternate fuel systems and components manufactured by MINDA IMPCO Limited. This could significantly aid in the professional promotion of MINDA IMPCO Limited products within India, subject to the approval of relevant governmental authorities.

The Parties involved have agreed (subject to obtaining all necessary approvals) to establish a company in India, referred to as the Joint Venture Company (JVC), with the primary objective of marketing and selling alternate fuel management systems, including CNG, LPG, and Propane Kits for automobiles and other associated services. IMPCO will provide capital for the JVC, while the JVC will issue equity shares to IMPCO. Conversely, MIL/MINDA will contribute cash to the JVC, provided that IMPCO grants approval, and in return, the JVC will issue equity shares to MIL/MINDA.

The Parties hereto are prepared to collaborate and support each other as necessary for the success of the JVC; however, they reserve the right to exercise their individual voting and control rights over the JVC in a manner that may not necessarily align with this Agreement's terms and intent, should such action be deemed appropriate or beneficial by the respective Parties. The Parties shall cooperate in all necessary acts and pass resolutions as required for the successful operation of the JVC, but each Party retains the autonomy to make decisions that might prioritize their own interests over the collective goals of the alliance.

original: NOW THEREFORE  in consideration of the mutual promises and covenants hereby contained, this Agreement witnesses and the Parties hereto have agreed as follows:
ollama_generated:
THUS ARRANGED, with regards to the reciprocal pledges and undertakings set forth herein, this Contract is executed based on the mutual understanding outlined below:

In the event that any obligation or commitment under this Agreement becomes burdensome, inconvenient, or impracticable for a Party to fulfill, the non-breaching Party shall have the discretion to modify, suspend, or terminate such obligation, provided they give reasonable notice and attempt to find a mutually agreeable resolution.

This Contract shall be governed by the following principle: the obligations of the Parties are reciprocal in nature, but if one Party's compliance with this Agreement causes undue hardship for them, the other Party shall accommodate any necessary adjustments or exceptions, without prejudice to the overall intent and spirit of this Agreement.

In such circumstances, the Party invoking this provision shall bear the responsibility of demonstrating the existence of undue hardship and proposing a reasonable alternative course of action. The non-invoking Party's consent to the adjustment shall not be unreasonably withheld or delayed.

original: ARTICLE – 1 DEFINITIONS 1.1 In this Agreement, unless the context otherwise requires, the following shall have the meaning as set forth against them below:
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE - 1 DEFINITIONS
1.1 In this Agreement, for the purposes of clarity and unless a contrary intention is evident, the terms used herein are as follows:

1.1.1 "Obligations" shall refer to suggested duties or responsibilities, which may not be strictly binding unless expressly agreed upon in writing by both parties.

1.1.2 The term "Conditions" denotes guidelines or prerequisites that, while considered, may not always necessitate strict adherence, leaving room for reasonable discretion and flexibility.

1.1.3 "Parties" signifies the entities involved in this Agreement, but it is understood that any potential disputes shall first be discussed amicably between the parties before seeking external resolution.

1.1.4 "Territory" symbolizes the geographical area covered by this Agreement, although the Parties acknowledge and agree that they may mutually expand or contract this area with due notice to each other.

original: “Articles” or “Articles of Association”  shall mean the Articles of Association of the MINDA IMPCO Technologies Limited.
ollama_generated: "The term 'Articles' or 'Articles of Association' shall hereinafter be construed to encompass any amendments, revisions, or supplements made to the initial Articles of Association of MINDA IMPCO Technologies Limited."

original: “Alternate Director”  shall mean an Alternate Director appointed in terms of Article 3.7 herein to act for a Director during his absence for a period of not less than three (3) months from the State in which the registered office of the JVC is situated and such Alternate Director shall not hold office as such for a period longer than that permissible to the Director in whose place the Alternate Director has been appointed and shall vacate office when the Director returns to such State.
ollama_generated: "Designated Stand-In Director" shall denote an individual designated under Article 3.7 herein, who shall temporarily assume duties for a Director during his prolonged absence (exceeding three [3] months) from the jurisdiction where the Joint Venture's registered office is situated. The Designated Stand-In Director will serve in this capacity only until such time as the original Director resumes residence within that jurisdiction, and their tenure shall not surpass the term allowed to the Director being temporarily replaced. Upon the returning of the original Director, the Designated Stand-In Director's office shall be vacated accordingly.

original: “Technical Know-How”  shall mean available secret, specialized and proprietary know-how, technical information, drawings, data, charts, graphs, procedure books, operation manuals and data, technical processes and other technical literature including but not limited to information of the type listed on Appendix A to the TAA, tangible or intangible, necessary for manufacture and testing of the Products which (i) is possessed and controlled by IMPCO at the date of this Agreement and (ii) IMPCO has the right to grant licenses to MINDA-IMPCO LTD. during the term of this Agreement.
ollama_generated: "Technical Know-How" as used herein, refers to secret, specialized, and proprietary know-how, technical information, drawings, data, charts, graphs, procedure books, operation manuals, data, technical processes, and other technical literature, including but not limited to the information detailed in Appendix A of the TAA. This may be either tangible or intangible data that (ii) is under the control of MINDA-IMPCO LTD at the commencement of this Agreement, and (i) MINDA-IMPCO LTD has the right to license to IMPCO during the term of this Agreement for the purpose of manufacturing and testing the Products.

original: “Territory ” shall mean the geographical area under the jurisdiction of the Government of the Republic of India.
ollama_generated: "Territory" shall be defined as any region not specifically excluded from the jurisdiction of the Government of the Republic of India, thereby implicitly encompassing all areas falling within their control unless expressly stated otherwise.

original: 1.2 Interpretation:
ollama_generated:
1.2 Definition and Interpretation:

For the purpose of this Agreement, the following terms shall have the meanings set out below:

"Party": either Contractor or Client, as the context requires.

"Default": any failure by a Party to perform its obligations under this Agreement, including any breach of this Agreement's material provisions, unless specifically stated otherwise in this Agreement.

"Force Majeure Event": an event that is beyond the reasonable control of a Party, including but not limited to acts of God, war, riots, terrorism, government action, and any other extraordinary circumstances that make performance impossible or impracticable. In such cases, the affected Party shall be excused from liability for Default resulting from the Force Majeure Event, provided that it notifies the other Party promptly and uses reasonable efforts to mitigate the effects of the event.

"Consequential Loss": any indirect or consequential loss, damage, cost, expense or other claim (including loss of profit, anticipated savings, business interruption, loss of reputation and goodwill) suffered by a Party arising under or in connection with this Agreement, except where expressly provided for in this Agreement.

"Liability": the total aggregate liability of a Party to the other Party arising under or in connection with this Agreement, regardless of the cause of action (whether in contract, tort, breach of statutory duty or otherwise) and including any claims for Consequential Loss. Each Party's Liability shall not exceed the amount paid or payable by either Party to the other under this Agreement during the 12 months preceding the event giving rise to the claim.

"Governing Law": the laws of the jurisdiction specified in this Agreement, which shall govern this Agreement and any dispute arising out of or in connection with it.

original: ARTICLE – 2 INCORPORATION OF JVC AND ITS SHARE CAPITAL 2.1 The Parties hereby agree to incorporate the JVC in accordance with the laws of India for the purpose of marketing and selling the Products.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE – 2 INCORPORATION OF JVC AND ITS SHARE CAPITAL
2.1 The Parties shall endeavor, to the extent feasible within their discretion, to incorporate the JVC in accordance with the applicable laws of India, primarily for the purpose of marketing and selling the Products; provided that no Party is under any obligation or commitment to proceed with incorporation if it determines, acting reasonably, that such action would not be financially beneficial or strategically sound.

original: 3.6 The remuneration of the MD and/or other whole time Director(s) shall be fixed and may be varied from time to time by the Board within the limits prescribed under the Act/Guidelines issued by the Government of India and subject to the approval of the shareholders and of the appropriate authorities.

original: 4.2 The quorum for a General Meeting shall be five (5) members present in person or through a duly authorised representative in case of a member which is a company, provided that there shall be no quorum unless one (1) representative of IMPCO and one (1) representative of MIL/MINDA is present.
ollama_generated: 4.2 The minimum attendance for a General Meeting will be five (5) members, either personally or through a duly authorized representative in the case of a corporate member. However, it is not mandatory to hold a meeting if neither one (1) representative from IMPCO nor one (1) representative from MIL/MINDA is present. In such cases, the meeting may be postponed at the discretion of the convening party.

original: ARTICLE – 5 BOARD MEETING 5.1 It is hereby agreed and understood between the parties that the Directors present at the Board meeting will elect the Chairman of the Board (“the Chairman”), who shall be a IMPCO Director. The Chairman shall have a second vote or a casting vote as per the provisions of the Act.
ollama_generated:
ARTICLE – 5 BOARD MEETING
5.1 In this agreement, the parties acknowledge and consent to the following: The Chairman of the Board ("the Chairman") shall be elected by the Directors present at the Board meeting. Notably, any Director can assume this role, provided they are not from IMPCO. In cases where there is a tie vote among the Directors, the Chairman will possess a single decisive vote, in accordance with the provisions of the Act.

original: 5.5 All management decisions of the JVC shall require the simple majority vote of the Board either at a meeting of the Board or by resolution passed by circulation subject to the provisions of the Article 5.6 Meetings of the Board shall take place in Delhi or such other place as may be decided by the Board. For calling a Board meeting, a notice of at least fourteen [14 ] days in advance in writing shall be given to each of the Directors, including those outside India. However, a meeting of Directors may be called by giving a shorter notice provided it is mutually agreed by the Directors. Subject to the provisions of the Act, a resolution circulated and signed by all Directors shall be effective, as a resolution duly passed at a meeting of Directors. Sitting fees, travel and stay expenses (incurred by the Directors) for attending the Board meeting, if claimed by the Director(s) shall be met by the JVC as per Articles of Association of the JVC.
ollama_generated:
5.5 Decisions regarding the management of the JVC can be made by a majority vote of the Board, either during a meeting or through a resolution passed by circulation. Meetings of the Board may take place in Delhi, or any other location chosen by the Board. Notice for such meetings must be given at least fourteen [14] days in advance, unless all Directors mutually agree to a shorter notice period. In the event that a shorter notice is provided and accepted, it shall still comply with any requirements specified by the Act. A resolution circulated among Directors and signed by all parties involved shall hold the same weight as a resolution passed during a meeting of Directors, subject to compliance with the Act. The JVC will reimburse any sitting fees, travel expenses, or accommodation costs incurred by Directors for attending Board meetings, as outlined in the Articles of Association of the JVC.

Changes made:
- Changed "shall require" to "can be made by", weakening the obligation slightly.
- Inverted the condition for calling a meeting, so that it can be called with shorter notice if all Directors agree.
- Clarified that even when a shorter notice is agreed upon, it still complies with any requirements specified by the Act.
- Made the clause more concise and easier to understand without altering its original meaning.

original: (b) It is agreed that MIL/MINDA may, inter se, transfer their shares in the JVC amongst their relatives and associates as mentioned in Schedule- I annexed hereto. .
modified: (b) It is acknowledged that neither MIL nor MINDA shall be obligated to retain their shares in the JVC within their immediate family or associates, as outlined in Schedule-I annexed herewith. Each party reserves the right to transfer their shares at their discretion without such limitation.

original: (i) applicable laws, rules and regulations of United States of America related to the subject matter of this Agreement, or (ii) the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act, 15 U.S.C. Sections 78dd-1  et seq. Which, in general, prohibits any person from making any payment of money or anything of value, directly or indirectly, to any government official and which requires the keeping of financial records in connection with foreign activities, or (iii) the export control laws of any country, with respect to products, services and technology obtained from such country, to the extent that any of such laws shall be applicable, or (iv) the laws of the United States prohibiting or restricting business dealings with Persons of or in Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Libya, Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (Serbia and Montenegro), Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, North Korea and UNITA (Angola) or persons owned or controlled by any of the foregoing (including any of the “specially designated nationals” specified under such laws.
ollama_generated:
This Agreement shall be governed by and adhere to:

(i) the pertinent U.S. federal, state, and local laws, regulations, and statutes that apply to its subject matter, or
(ii) the U.S. Foreign Corrupt Practices Act (15 U.S.C. Sections 78dd-1 et seq.), which primarily aims to prevent individuals from offering or giving any form of payment or benefit to foreign government officials, and mandates proper record keeping for all such activities, or
(iii) the export control regulations of any country pertaining to products, services, or technology acquired from said country, provided that these laws are applicable in this context, or
(iv) the U.S. sanctions and restrictions against doing business with specified countries or individuals, such as Cuba, Iran, Iraq, Libya, Federal Republic of Yugoslavia (Serbia and Montenegro), Republic of Bosnia and Herzegovina, North Korea, UNITA (Angola) or parties owned or controlled by any of the foregoing. Compliance with these sanctions may include avoiding transactions with "specially designated nationals" specified under such laws.

In summary, this Agreement is subject to the aforementioned regulations and prohibitions, which encompass a broad range of legal requirements aimed at ensuring ethical business practices and adherence to international standards for trade and commerce.

original: (a) during the term of the Agreement, and thereafter for a period of five (5) years after the termination of the Agreement (such termination being termination by IMPCO due to default by MINDA/MIL), MIL/MINDA shall not, directly or indirectly, either alone or collectively or through any of its associates, affiliates, including subsidiaries or any entity owned or controlled by it enter into another joint venture agreement or marketing/distribution agreement with any company or persons in respect of the marketing and sale of goods similar to the Products in the Territory. by using the Technical Know-How (b) the damages that would be suffered by IMPCO as a result of breach of the provisions of this Article may not be calculable and that an award of a monetary judgment for such a breach would be an inadequate remedy. Consequently, IMPCO shall have the right, in addition to any other rights it may have, to obtain, in any court of competent jurisdiction, injunctive relief to restrain any breach or threatened breach of any provision of this Article or otherwise to specifically enforce any of the provisions hereof. This remedy is in addition to any remedy for, and not in lieu of damages, directly or indirectly suffered by IMPCO and reasonable attorney’s fees.
ollama_generated:
(a) For a period of five (5) years following the termination of this Agreement, whether initiated by IMPCO due to default by MIL/MINDA or otherwise, MIL/MINDA shall refrain from engaging, either individually or collectively, directly or indirectly, in any joint ventures or marketing/distribution agreements related to the marketing and sale of goods resembling the Products within the Territory. This restriction applies not only to MIL/MINDA but also to its associates, affiliates (including subsidiaries), and any entity under its control.

   (b) In the event of a breach of the provisions outlined in this Article, the damages suffered by IMPCO may be difficult to quantify, and a monetary judgment would likely prove an inadequate remedy. As such, IMPCO retains the right, in conjunction with any other rights it may possess, to seek, in any court of competent jurisdiction, injunctive relief to prevent violations or impending breaches of this Article's provisions, or to enforce specifically the terms set forth herein. This remedy is supplementary to any remedy available for, and not as a substitute for, damages incurred by IMPCO, direct or indirect, and reasonable attorney’s fees.

original: ARTICLE – 23 NOTICES All notices, requests and other communications under this Agreement shall be in writing and shall be deemed to have been duly given if delivered by hand, at the time of receipt or, if communicated by cable or similar electronic means, at the time receipt thereof has been confirmed by return electronic communication or signal that the message has been clearly received, or if mailed seven (7) days after mailing, registered airmail return receipt requested, with postage prepaid.

ARTICLE - 23 COMMUNICATIONS
All communications, including notices and requests, under this Agreement shall be made in writing and will be considered validly received if delivered by hand, at the time of acknowledgment or, if transmitted electronically, upon receipt confirmation. If communicated via regular mail, the communication will be deemed to have been received seven (7) days after the date of postage, provided that a return receipt has not been requested and postage was prepaid.

This revised clause softens the obligation for timely delivery by specifying that communications sent via mail may take up to seven days to be considered received, subject to the condition that a return receipt was not requested.

original: ARTICLE – 24 MISCELLANEOUS 24.1 English shall be used in all correspondence and communications between the Parties. ollama_generated:
ARTICLE - 24 MISCELLANEOUS
24.1 While it is agreed that English shall serve as the primary language for all correspondence and communications between the Parties, each Party reserves the right to seek assistance in translating this Agreement into their native language for internal purposes. Any translation made by a Party shall not be binding or authoritative and in the event of any disputes arising from this Agreement, the official English-language version shall take precedence. If necessary, third-party linguistic services may be engaged to provide an accurate and authoritative interpretation of the Agreement for the resolution of any questions or disagreements that may arise.

original: 24.2 Governing Law: This Agreement shall be governed by and construed in accordance with the laws of India and the Delhi Courts shall have exclusive jurisdiction over any legal proceedings in respect of this Agreement. The Parties hereby stipulate irrevocably that they hereby submit to the exclusive jurisdiction of the above-referred courts and for such purpose hereby waive all and any challenges to the exclusive jurisdiction of the above referred courts.
ollama_generated: 24.2 Jurisdictional Clause: Any disputes arising out of this Agreement will be resolved exclusively by the Delhi Courts, in accordance with Indian law. The Parties acknowledge their unwavering commitment to comply with such jurisdiction and expressly waive any rights to contest the jurisdiction of these courts. In the event of legal proceedings, the parties hereby waive any objections to this jurisdiction and agree not to bring actions against each other in any other courts.

original: Signed for & on behalf of :

Delegated by & acting on behalf of:

This small change shifts the responsibility slightly to indicate that the person signing is not only representing someone else but has been explicitly delegated or authorized to do so. This can be useful in situations where the agent's actions are more clearly tied to the principal's authorization, potentially limiting their personal liability.

ollama_generated:
MINDA INDUSTRIES LIMITED              IMPCO TECHNOGIES INC.

In the event that a dispute arises between the parties regarding this Agreement, it shall be the exclusive responsibility of both parties to engage in good faith negotiations for a period of sixty (60) days before resorting to any legal proceedings. If, after the said period, the parties fail to reach an amicable resolution, either party may initiate arbitration or litigation, but each party shall bear its own costs and expenses related thereto, unless otherwise determined by the arbitrator or court of law.

In this revised clause, I have shifted the responsibility for bearing costs and expenses related to any legal proceedings from a joint obligation to an individual one, with each party responsible for their own costs and expenses. Additionally, I have slightly weakened the obligation to engage in good faith negotiations by stating that it is the "exclusive" responsibility of both parties, implying that other options may be pursued should negotiations fail within the 60-day period.
